name: Holiday Inn Ipswich-Orwell

reviews.text: Spent two nights here attending a family wedding.Including .the reception that was held in the .
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Rooms were very comfortable and beds/pillows excellent.Lovely evening meal on friday night and a good breakfast on the two mornings.
reviews.title: Poor service & dated rooms

reviews.text: All staff were excellent, service always polite, rooms clean. The reception meal was lovely and while we were there 'Murphys' was half price!!!!
reviews.title: great, friendly place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Duty manager was Carl who always had a cheeky smile carried out his 101 duties seamlessly (thanks Carl for putting up with us (well me anyway).
reviews.title: Added bonus is use of David Lloyd club

reviews.text: Therefore, well recommended.
reviews.title: 'Neat Rooms,Kind Staff'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel as a stop over before we took the ferry to Holland, it was much further away from the ferry port than we thought though! Anyway, it was a lovely, clean hotel with a comfortable double room. The staff were helpful & polite. There was a wedding going on the same day & the atmosphere was really lovely. Despite it being situated near a busy road, it was set back enough & is surrounded by trees & gardens giving it a more secluded feel.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, helpful staff.

reviews.text: Two night stay on business and as many say it's best described as tired. However I would say that I sensed a little sense of aspiration for improvement, but it will require some hard work. Bar and dining area need replanting and are not relaxing in the slightest. Morning breakfast is not great. I had to get up and ask for a second coffee, interrupting chatting staff.
reviews.title: Mediocre and probably overpriced
Very tired
reviews.text: Rooms are ok, but in desperate need of refurb and previous management suggest this is on the cards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A new evening menu is probably better than what was before but is not inspiring and tempting, especially as there are 2 walking distance 'harvester' style pubs nearby. Restaurant was unsurprisingly totally empty on both nights when I ate.
reviews.title: What happened to the Wi-Fi

reviews.text: With hard work and vision there is potential here, meantime the other hol inn in Ipswich wins.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn not what it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed overnight on our way to a family funeral and were pleasantly surprised at the value. The room was clean and tidy, though I would have liked more than two tea bags as I am not a coffee drinker. Staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was delicious. We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: This is our third stay here and have no complaints. Bed is very comfortable and the hotel is quiet and easy to find.Only negative if I was pushed is the restaurant service can be a bit slow. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: comfortable stay everytime

reviews.text: I've used several venues in Suffolk for casual business meetings. For the first time I used the Holiday Inn, Ipswich Orwell to meet with someone regarding business. I feel compelled to commend the member of staff working on the bar. I believe her name was Ali / Alison. She was exceptionally friendly with a warm welcome and a credit to your business. I feel all too often people are expedient to criticise people and seldom offer words of praise. Please pass on my sincere thanks to her for making a comfortable atmosphere. Kind Regards
reviews.title: 5* Customer Service
Review of The Priory Restaurant & conference facilities.
reviews.text: I was staying at the Premier Inn over the road but was a day delegate for a training course at The Holiday Inn and also returned to the restaurant in the evening.
Conference facilities: excellent. We had all we needed and the staff were only too happy to help.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.text: Room was presented well. Temperature was far too hot. Unable to turn radiators down. Window only opened a couple of cms. Became unbearable so left as early as possible wearing a t shirt to car. Ridiculous.
reviews.title: Room clean but far too hot.

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice and found it the same each time - pleasant and efficient staff but restaurant not a strength - probably because it doesn't attract much trade, being off the beaten track. Was not impressed by hoovering carpet for breakfast before I'd finished my dinner on the first occasion. Rooms are clean and well serviced and the car park is convenient.
reviews.title: OK. Not up to usual Holiday Inn standard

reviews.text: Would use it mainly because of loyalty card points.
reviews.title: Good basic hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here on business located just off the a14 just after the Orwell bridge. It's a bit out of Ipswich but perfect if doing business in Felixstowe or the euro park.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Excellent Staff

reviews.text: The rooms and hotel are Ok for 3 star, if a bit dated, it really could do with a makeover but its fine for 1 night. Rooms were clean bed comfy and breakfast ok. On site free parking
reviews.title: No Room at the Inn

description: The Holiday Inn Ipswich-Orwell Hotel is ideally located at Junction 57 on the A14, only 10 minutes from Ipswich Town Centre, 15 minutes from the Suffolk Coast and 5 minutes from Trinity Park the home of the Suffolk Show.The Hotel boasts extensive free car parking and a selection of Queen Double and King Double/Twin Bedrooms some with sofa beds for families. A further 6 Executive Rooms are the ideal business choice with mini bars and laptops safes, in addition 2 open plan Suites add the final touch of luxury for those special occasions.The Hotel offers a range of dining experiences, The Priory Restaurant, Bar and Lounge offer informal modern dining with a large choice of food and drink options complimented with daily specials to suit the needs of both the Corporate and Leisure Guest. The Holiday Inn Ipswich-Orwell Hotel has a range of conference and banqueting rooms, with Wi-Fi access available in these and also the public areas, whilst wired access is available in all bedrooms.The Hotel offers an onsite Gym and within walking distance, a state of the art Full Leisure Complex is available to guests at a small nominal charge.The Holiday Inn Ipswich-Orwell Hotel, close enough to access the business districts and Adastral Park, whilst still being the ideal base to enjoy the rest of East Anglia and all that it can offer.
